accueil.message: Tu dois être connecté pour accéder

documente-ton-oeuvre.preambule: Hi! We will help you describe your work.

televersement.soustitre: WAV or MP3 only, 100 MB maximum.

collaborateurs.titre: What are the roles of each in {oeuvre} ?
collaborateurs.role: What is your role in the work?

paroles.titre: Type in the lyrics of your work

genre.titre: What are the genres of the work ?

entete.exemple: Exemple : The Beatles, Dr Dre, Mozart, Jacques Brel, Stromae...
entete.parole-only: Lyrics only. Do not add Authors, Composers, year of creation, etc.

documenter.titre1: Who participated in the creation of “{{titre}}?”
documenter.titre1-description: That's where you mention who contributed to the creation of this piece.
documenter.auteur-description: Who wrote the lyrics of this musical piece?
documenter.compositeur-description: Who composed the music of this piece?
documenter.arrangeur-description: Who remixed the music of this piece?
documenter.editeur-description: Who represents these authors and/or composers?
documenter.codeiswc-description: The International Standard Work Code is a unique identifying code for music work.
documenter.titre2: Who played the musical piece on this sound recording?
documenter.titre2-description: Here you mention who played which instrument.

options.question2: Which role in the musical piece?

documenter.titre3-description: Here you mention who contributed to the sound recording of this piece.
documenter.realisation-description: The Sound Producer creates the sound environement of the music track.
documenter.son-description: Who's the Recording Engineer on your music track?
documenter.mix-description: This is the step of volume and frequency adjustment.
documenter.master-description: This is the step of compression and overall equalization of the song.
documenter.studio-description: The place(s) where the song was recorded.
documenter.production-description: The person or compagny that invest time or money to make sound recording possible.
documenter.etiquette-description: That's the organisation that handles the marketing of your track.
documenter.distribution-description: That's the organisation that delivers your music track to streaming and downloading stores.
documenter.codeupc-description: A UPC (Universal Product Code) or EAN (International Article Number) is a unique code used to identify a digital product.
documenter.date: Release date of the musical piece (if applicable)
documenter.date-description: The moment when the piece is launched on platforms.
documenter.titre4: Which files would you like grant access to?
documenter.titre4-description: Here you can add all files related to this musical piece.
documenter.titre5-description: Here you mention what is the genre of this musical piece and what are the artists or trends that inspired it.
documenter.titre6-description: Words in a song are excellent descriptive data about the artwork that increases its discoverability and the chances to expands its audience.
documenter.titre7: Was the musical piece already broadcasted?
documenter.titre7-description: To increase the chances for your track to be discovered and listened to, document its streaming and online shopping links.
documenter.titre8-description: An album has a cover, a song or an instrumental track must also have a cover artwork to represent it. Learn more
documenter.titre8-etape1: Upload in JPEG or PNG format
documenter.titre8-etape2: Recommended: Square image of 1600 x 1600 pixels with a resolution of 300 dpi.
documenter.titre9-description: Here you can upload your track in WAV or MP3 format.
documenter.autre-description: Here you can add documents for the track's performance, such as the partition or the MIDI file.
documenter.autre-etape2: You can upload a graphic score or tablature format format (.PDF, .SVG, .PNG ou .JPEG). You can also chose to upload a native scorewriters software file.
documenter.details: Tell us more about the track.
documenter.public: Public - Make the information visible for all
documenter.tous: All users can have access to this information.
documenter.invite-description: Users provided with a unique shareable link are able to download the original file. Pretty convenient for journalists and professionals!
documenter.prive-description: Only you can download the original image.

pro.preambule: Your intellectual property is identified with two numbers: UPC and ISRC (if recorded). Link them here.

voter.connexion: You shall be connected to access the vote page
voter.soustitre: Hi, {{nom}}, here is the voting page for your work:

preambules.intro1: Create the shares on your rights using our guide. You'll see, it's a lot easier than you think :)
preambules.intro2: Make your work known on the web thanks to metadata, increasing your chances of to appear in playlists.
preambules.intro3: In the good old days, a cassette was sent by registered mail to prove who did the work and when. Now we rather use a blockchain to create this proof :)

proposition.sous-titre: To finalize this split, you have to invite your collaborators to validate it all. Indicate their email addresses to which you are sending your split proposition.
proposition.voter-avec-jeton: You can only vote by clicking on the email that was sent to you when the proposal was created.
proposition.pourquoi: Mention to your contributors why you're not comfortable with this split.

acr.erreur-inconnu: No match found for the submitted file.

bienvenue.preambule: You have successfully registered a new account.
bienvenue.indication: We've sent you a email. Please click on the confirmation link to verify your account.

passwordchanged.indication: Your password has been changed successfully.

oublier.preambule: Enter the email address associated with your account to receive a code and reset your password.

fin.maintenantPartage: The split proposition now exists. Bravo!

televersement.encours: Please wait while we store and analyse your file

socan.condition: I agree to SOCAN's Terms & Conditions of Membership.

connecter: You must be connected to vote
selection: A selection in this list is mandatory

tooltip.egal: Divide the copyright by the number of people and assign the role “Author-Composer” by default to all. This way of sharing copyright avoids many disagreements among creators, particularly when the income starts to come in!
tooltip.roles: Divide the copyright into two: 50% goes to those who wrote the lyrics, and 50% to those who composed the music. This last “music” part is in return divided by the number of roles elected and the collaborators get a percentage according to their implication. For example: Alice only composes music, while Bob compose AND arrange music. Therefore, Alice has 1/3 and Bob has 2/3 of the music.
tooltip.manuel: Lets you determine the percentage and the roles for each collaborator. To set a percentage to a collaborator, you can use the lock.

options-acces.tous: All users can download the original file.
options-acces.lien: Users with the unique shareable link can download the original file. Useful for reporters and the professionals!
options-acces.personne: Nobody will be able to download, except you.
